title: ProLight + Sound 2023: Day Four - The Light Sound Journal
summary: Visual Productions, Luminex, Lumen Radio, Martin and Hollyland showcased their latest green innovations at ProLight+Sound 2023. These innovations included new products such as the CueCore3, Purple Cloud and RdmRelay from Visual Productions, the GigaCore 20t, 18t and 16t from Luminex, the Galileo TX and RX from Lumen Radio, the MAC Aura XIP and MAC Ultra Performance from Martin, and the Solidcom C1 Pro from Hollyland. These products are designed to meet the needs of the professional AV market and offer features such as improved reliability, ease of use and environmental sustainability.

title: Global Raman Spectroscopy Market Report 2023: Increased Focus on Drug Development in the Healthcare Sector ... - GlobeNewswire
summary: The global Raman spectroscopy market is projected to reach USD 1.1 billion by 2028 from USD 0.8 billion in 2023, at a CAGR of 7.0% from 2023 and 2028. The handheld & portable Raman instrument is expected to account for the largest market share in Raman spectroscopy hardware market during the forecast period. Continuous technological development of nanotechnology and extensive theoretical and experimental research has significantly broadened the scope of surface-enhanced Raman scattering and increased its demand in pharmaceutical, life science, and materials science research.
green_innovation: TRUE; The article describes the development of new Raman Micro-Spectroscopy technique that can image polymer phase distributions, a ground-breaking biosensor platform for early-stage cancer diagnosis, implementation of Transmission Raman Spectroscopy for fast content uniformity testing, and enhancements in Raman measurements using high-throughput virtual slit spectrometers. These innovations contribute to environmental sustainability goals, such as reducing harmful substances and improving resource consumption.
business_innovation: TRUE; The article describes the development of a new handheld Raman spectroscopy instrument called the Agilent Vaya Raman raw material identity verification system, which accelerates quality control testing in the pharmaceuticals and biopharmaceutical industries. It is a new product or improved business process that differs significantly from the firmâ€™s previous products or business processes and that has been introduced on the market.
